com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.map

Class MapPlayerInput

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bergerkiller.bukkit.common.map.MapPlayerInput
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Tickable

    public class MapPlayerInput
extends java.lang.Object
implements Tickable
    Input controller for virtual map navigation and UI. A single instance manages the input coming from a single player.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  MapPlayerInput.Key
      The key belonging to a key change event for a player

        public final boolean isFakeMountShown()
        Gets whether a fake mount is currently spawned and mounted by the player to intercept input
        Returns:
        True if the fake mount is shown, False if not.

        Returns:

        Parameters:
        key - to query
        Returns:
        True if pressed down, False if not

      • wasPressed

        public boolean wasPressed(MapPlayerInput.Key key)
        Gets whether a particular key was pressed down before. Combine this with isPressed(Key) to monitor key changes.
        Parameters:
        key - to query
        Returns:
        True if it was pressed down, False if not

      • getLeftRight

        public int getLeftRight()
        Gets the left/right movement state (-1, 0, or 1). Pressing A will result in -1, pressing D will result in 1.
        Returns:
        left/right state

      • getUpDown

        public int getUpDown()
        Gets the up/down movement state (-1, 0, or 1). Pressing W will result in -1, pressing S will result in 1.
        Returns:
        up/down state

      • getBackEnter

        public int getBackEnter()
        Gets the back/enter movement state (-1, 0, or 1). Pressing shift will result in -1, pressing Spacebar will result in 1.
        Returns:
        back/enter state

      • receiveInput

        public boolean receiveInput(int dx,
                            int dy,
                            int dz)
        Updates the received input state, receiving input information. If no receivers are interested in this input, False is returned.
        Parameters:
        dx - - left/right
        dy - - up/down
        dz - - enter/back
        Returns:
        whether input will be handled by a map display
